title: Skyscanner mastermind lands £375m Sykes Cottages buyout
text:
Former Skyscanner and Just Eat backer Vitruvian Partners has won the race to buy Sykes Cottages in a deal worth £375m.

The sale seals a healthy return for City investment firm Livingbridge, which bought Sykes in 2015 for £54m. Sykes’ portfolio of holiday homes has grown from around 5,000 to 17,500 in the last five years.

Bidding for Sykes, one of Britain’s largest providers of self-catering holiday properties, had piqued the interest of Butlin’s owner Bourne Leisure, alongside private equity duo L Catterton and Clayton Dubilier & Rice.

But it was Vitruvian, whose investments have also included Darktrace and FarFetch, that completed the acquisition on Monday.

The eponymous holiday company was...
description: Former Skyscanner and Just Eat backer Vitruvian Partners has won the race to buy Sykes Cottages in a deal worth £375m.
